alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Merrimack; Southern Carroll; Southern Grafton; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 04 at 3:28PM EDT until April 06 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SLEET AND FREEZING RAIN EXPECTED WEDNESDAY INTO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... .Cooler air arriving tonight will allow a spring storm system to bring a mix of wintry precipitation, mainly in the form of freezing rain and sleet. Precipitation will onset Wednesday, with the bulk of sleet and freezing rain falling north of the mountains. Come Wednesday evening, these chances improve into the foothills and interior locations where some slick conditions may last into early Thursday morning. Temperatures are forecast to rise above freezing rapidly Thursday morning, bringing an end to freezing precipitation. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM WEDNESDAY TO 8 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations up to one inch, sleet accumulations between one tenth and two tenths of an inch and limited ice accumulations around two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Maine. Portions of central and northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From 2 PM Wednesday to 8 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Even light ice and snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause slippery surface conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the late Wednesday evening and early Thursday morning commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
